intro: Hieracium narecense, commonly known as swamp hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetlands and moist meadows in Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Hieracium narecense is adapted to waterlogged soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems.
